titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Doug Johnson, July 15, 2016; machine-readable finding aid created by Caroline Cub√©.

address.addressline: Room A1713, Charles E. Young Research Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2017-08-02T13:38-0700

did.abstract: William Bast was a television and film writer, as well as a friend and biographer of James Dean. The William Bast papers consists largely of scripts written over the course of more than forty years.
did.physloc: Stored off-site at SRLF. Advance notice is required for access to the collection. Please contact the UCLA Library Special Collections Reference Desk for paging information.

accessrestrict.head: Restrictions on Access
accessrestrict.p: COLLECTION STORED OFF-SITE AT SRLF: Open for research. Advance notice required for access. Contact the UCLA Library Special Collections Reference Desk for paging information.

userestrict.head: Restrictions on Use and Reproduction
userestrict.p: Property rights to the physical object belong to the UCLA Library Special Collections. Literary rights, including copyright, are retained by the creators and their heirs. It is the responsibility of the researcher to determine who holds the copyright and pursue the copyright owner or his or her heir for permission to publish where The UC Regents do not hold the copyright.

phystech.head: Physical Characteristics and Technical Requirements
phystech.p: COLLECTION CONTAINS AUDIOVISUAL MATERIALS: Audiovisual materials in this collection will require assessment and possible digitization for safe access. To review these audiovisual materials, you must notify the UCLA Library Special Collections Reference Desk in advance of your visit.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], William Bast Papers (Collection 2290). UCLA Library Special Collections, Charles E. Young Research Library, University of California, Los Angeles.

bioghist.head: Biography/History
bioghist.p: William Bast was born in Wisconsin in 1931. While attending college at UCLA he shared an apartment with James Dean. Later, he and Dean moved to New York City independently of one another and roomed together there as well. In 1956, a year after the actor's death, Bast published the first biography of Dean. In the 1960s Bast began writing for television, both in Hollywood and in London. He worked in a variety of genres, including medical dramas ( Ben Casey), science fiction ( The Outer Limits), and crime shows ( Hawaii Five-O). In the 1980s he created, with his partner Paul Huson, the short-lived series Tucker's Witch and The Colbys, a spin-off the wildly popular program Dynasty. Bast and Huson continued their collaboration throughout the 1990s, writing several television movies. In 2006 Bast published a second biography, Surviving James Dean, in which he revealed that their relationship had occasionally been sexual in nature. William Bast died in Los Angeles on May 4, 2015.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: The collection consists mostly of scripts written by William Bast across his career, both produced and unproduced. Projects from early in his career tend to be represented by only a single script, while later projects often have several drafts, some heavily annotated. These later projects are often accompanied by agreements, research material, and some production documents. There is a very small amount of personal correspondence. There is also very little about James Dean, and most of what is present is in the context of the television movie based on Bast's first biography.

arrangement.head: Organization and Arrangement
arrangement.p:
The collection is organized into the following series:
Series 1. Television productions
Series 2. Feature film productions
Series 3. Unproduced material
Series 4. General files

odd.head: General note
odd.p: Unless otherwise noted, all scripts and script material are by William Bast.

arrangement.head: Organization and Arrangement
arrangement.p: Titles are in alphabetical order. Within each title, script material is listed first, in chronological order. Additional materials are then listed in alphabetical order.

scopecontent.p: Includes outline.

phystech.head: Physical Characteristics and Technical Requirements note
phystech.p: FOLDER CONTAINS AUDIOVISUAL MATERIALS: Audiovisual materials in this folder will require assessment and possible digitization for safe access. To review these audiovisual materials, you must notify the UCLA Library Special Collections Reference Desk in advance of your visit.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes typed and handwritten notes [badly damaged]; two handwritten letters from Gloria Stuart, who had her first role in almost thirty years here; material from the Society of the Friends of Lizzie Borden, part of the Unicorn Hunters of Lake Superior State College.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes copy of a letter to Dimitri Mitropoulos, October 26, 1958; two letters from Colin Wilson, May, 1959; two letters from John Valva, Roddy McDowall's companion on the set of Cleopatra (1963), 1962; copies of two letters to Ingo Preminger about Bunny Lake Is Missing, 1962.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes clippings; inquiries from fans and would-be biographers; questionnaires with William Bast's responses; proposal for a book of Sanford Roth photographs, with text by William Bast and Paul Huson.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains material about William Bast's first biography of Dean; royalty report; correspondence regarding publication in Japan and re-publication in the United States.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains what appears to be an epistolary short story.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes essays describing Igor Stravinsky conducting Oedipus Rex at Royal Festival Hall with Jean Cocteau reading his text.

did.unittitle: "Show the Nice Lady Your Tail, Daniel"

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains drafts of a short story.
